562118978,"Associate Director, Global Regulatory Affairs Asia Pacific",2017-06-02T13:08:13Z,1,"Johnson & Johnson is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly based healthcare Company, touching the lives of nearly a billion people every day. Our Family of Companies throughout the world compete in consumer, pharmaceutical and medical devices and diagnostics markets and have the skills and resources to tackle the world’s most pressing health issues.  POSITION SUMMARY: The Regional Management Center (RMC) is a new regional organization to handle the majority of LOC activities led by senior regional regulatory staff, where they handle tactical LCM processes (CMC Variations and Labeling Changes) in the region. The center will be embedded in the AP, EMEA and LA regional organizations, and it will work in close collaboration with the respective LOC’s and regional and global departments.  The RMC is a virtual, dedicated team consisting of GRA regional team members (direct reports) and LOC team members (matrix organization). In order to enable the RMC to achieve its deliverables in terms of quality, compliance and efficiency, an integrated planning is key, in which global, regional and local submission plans are consolidated and which will translate in optimal resource allocation across clusters and countries.  The Regulatory Planning & Compliance Manager drives integrated planning to enable the RMC to achieve deliverables with optimal resourcing. He or she is responsible for the maintenance and compliance of the RMC planning tool and integrating submission planning from global, regional, and local RA. The incumbent will be accountable to engage stakeholders throughout the process to define best fit planning and assign submissions to RMC staff and monitor progress. In this role the Regulatory Planning & Compliance Manager will be the single point of contact (SPOC) for Global teams on planning, prioritization, escalation, in which he/she closely aligns with the RMC head. Together with the RMC team, he or she will seek continuous improvement of the processes and propositions.  The Asia Pacific RMC Operations Manager reports to the Asia Pacific RMC Head.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: + Single Point of Contact (SPOC) for Global CMC and Labeling CoE to disseminate variation updates for RMC and Local operating Company + Manage milestone planning for Local operating Company & RMC team + Optimize and maintain planning/managing tool and provide oversight to Local operating Company + Collaborate pro-actively with Global, RMC team and Local operating Company for priority changes or potential compliance risk + Supports in the set-up of the RMC and onboarding of the LOCs + Optimize and maintain the RMC planning tool + Embeds the planning process in the region and drives continuous improvement + Collect input from involved Global, Regional, Local regulatory teams + Drive integrated planning process by engaging RA stakeholders to ensure insight on all inputs + Identifies gaps / areas for clarification (with CMC & Global Labeling, LOC, RMC team members) + Take action to close these gaps in liaison with Global, Regional, Local and RMC regulatory teams + Monitor resource planning and pro-actively act on potential conflicts + Monitor milestone planning and report to RMC head, Local, Regional, and Global regulatory teams + Create resource report (overview) for RMC + Single point of contact for Global (CMC RA and Labeling CoE) to align on planning, address prioritization and escalation in case of potentiation compliance risks + Collaborate with RMC Professionals and dossier leads on dossiers in scope, in case of priority changes or potential compliance risks + Ensure compliance with submission and approval deadlines  REQUIRED LEADERSHIP COMPETENCIES (J&J REGULATORY AFFAIRS COMPENTENCY MODEL): •Business acumen (Applying): Leverages knowledge of the sector, organization, Regulatory Affairs function, and cross-functional business partners to make informed business decisions and create and execute business strategies. Assesses the impact of current regulatory requirements on the business to assist in the development of innovative Regulatory strategies and/or innovative ways to execute them. Executes results-oriented Regulatory Affairs strategies that are aligned with organizational objectives. Manages projects within timeline requirements. •Decision Making & Priority (Leading): Clearly defines and prioritizes decision criteria and considers benefits and risks of each decision and its immediate and future implications. Considers all of the available facts when situations are ambiguous in order to make the best possible decision. Manages multiple and changing priorities based on factors such as time constraints, urgency, and business need. Manages complex or ambiguous situations including integration of large amounts of changing, complex, or ambiguous information. Navigates a complex organizational structure to make effective, complex decisions and achieve strategic and/or project goals. •Leading & Influencing (Applying): Leverages an understanding of others’ motivations, needs, and concerns to establish trust and credibility and influence others. Demonstrates conviction, proactivity and persistence when influencing internal and external stakeholders with or without direct authority or formalized structure. Creates compelling negotiating positions that build support and consensus among key stakeholders. Leverages internal networks to enhance collaboration, information sharing, and form strategic partnerships. •Persuasive Communication (Leading): Delivers and creates tailored communications and presentations that educate and mobilize critical stakeholders and translates complex information into key facts and rational arguments that are influential, meaningful, and actionable. Fully engages others by asking incisive and thought provoking questions, always ensuring mutual understanding. Develops written technical communications that are influential, meaningful, and tailored to the audience and business need, including translating complex or technical information into simplified explanations to promote understanding.  WORKING RELATIONSHIPS/INTERFACES: Within RMC: •With RMC Specialists on specific tasks (Data administrator, Label Coordinator, Artwork specialist) •With RMC Professionals in collaborating on cross-cluster submission) With LOC: •Regulatory Head and Local Regulatory staff, as needed by project activities to define and evaluate integrated planning Within Global Regulatory Affairs: Global and Regional departments (RSI, RSMO, CMC, Labeling CoE and regional TA-members), as needed to define and evaluate integrated planning REQUIRED TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES & KNOWLEDGE Regulatory Strategy: + Understanding of the pharmaceutical industry and experience in drug development and/or marketed products. + Analytical skills and technical RA knowledge (ability to assess impact of CMC variation or Label change on current situation). + Detail-orientation combined with big picture orientation. + Ability to quickly acquire local knowledge and shift between local and regional situations+ learning agility.  Planning: + Understanding of resources, time, expertise, etc. required to complete LCM-projects. + Understanding and ability to lead process-improvement and –optimization projects. + Understanding of planning-and tracking system to ensure oversight and compliance.  Drive execution: + Project management: get things done, drive execution, and collaborate in virtual teams. + Communication skills and cultural sensitivity in working with stakeholders across countries + Proficient in English (incl. technical RA English). + Team player able to effectively collaborate with colleagues in virtual environment and able to do efficient handovers.  Submissions: + Solid RA submission knowledge

For AP, location in Singapore is preferred but not required. + Must be able to work flexible hours to accommodate early morning/evening meetings/ teleconferences with different time zones + Occasional international travel (3-5x/year) may be required  TRAVEL REQUIRED This role requires less than 10% of the time  Please note that there is no relocation assistance provision for this position. 562119055,Supply Chain Project Manager,2017-06-02T13:08:21Z,1,"About Our Client    In line with the Global Supply Chain strategy the purpose of this role is to provide functional excellence in planning to drive best practice, build capability and help to deliver best in class performance.   The Regional Planning Excellence Manager role is responsible for driving excellence in our planning processes, systems and people capability to ensure an integrated, standardised and consistent supply planning operating model is in place across the envelope to help achieve best in class benchmarks in performance, including stock/product availability, service and inventory performance. This role is key to align and integrate the planning function with the service delivery improvements across the GSC and SPU.        Key Responsibilities    The Regional Planning Excellence Manager will work closely with the Global Planning Manager to provide strategic thought leadership, build best practise and provide functional expertise.   Specific accountabilities (Implementation and deployment will be in conjunction with the Envelope, and regional and local Planning Managers & Global Planning Excellence Manager).    Drive process excellence in planning, by developing and deploying consistent and best in class planning processes and policies across the envelope:   Ensure an integrated supply planning operating model is established and maintained across the region.   Manage the right first time delivery and execution of the Planning Excellence master plan across the region, including the use of PMO toolkits, stage gate reviews and management of milestones to plan.   Working with the Finished Products & Planning Manager to drive improvements in the supply element of the process to deliver and maintain Oliver Wight “capable” status and to drive CI in the GSC process. This includes the Inter Envelope Supply Review process.   Working with The Regional NPI Product life Cycle Manager to ensure a clear robust NPI process well integrated into the business process including the RSR to provide a 24-36 months view of planned strategic product changes as well as regular updates on milestone deliveries and emerging supply chain issues.   Working with Network Optimization Manager to ensure a clear robust Optimization and Costing process are well integrated into the business process, generate strategic Vulnerabilities & Opportunities conversation and solid actions.   To establish local supply review process across all key plants and 3rd party manufacturers in support of the business process.   To drive standardisation of Planning KPI’s across the envelope in alignment with global standards, ensuring compliance across the region. Develop track and trend local and regional KPI’s providing weekly / monthly updates to business as appropriate and driving actions to deliver business targets (for example schedule adherence, plan adherence, first pick availability, materials and finished goods inventory etc.).      Develop, maintain and ensure compliance to documented ways of working across the region.    Develop and deploy a functional capability program to build excellence in supply planning across the envelope, including coaching of the planning community across the region.   Develop and deploy supply chain planning tools and systems strategy (with IT&S) across the envelope, fully integrated with the processes, and drive the elimination of ‘off-line'.   Develop and deploy a roadmap to deliver best in class benchmarks and year on year performance improvements while meeting service objectives across the envelope.   Joint accountability for in-year performance of key planning related measures, such as stock/product availability, IFOT and inventory performance (including SLOBS). Drive the delivery of KPI improvements e.g. Stock availability, IFOT, Days of Cover reduction etc. and development of next year’s pipeline of improvement activities with the regional and local planning managers.   Effective leadership and influencing skills to deliver the accountabilities in this role while operating through a zone of influence rather than authority.   Ability to lead transformational change while delivering results (“fix while flying the plane”).   Functional expertise to deliver a step change in planning maturity from basic to best in class performance in 3 years.   Ability to implement standardized processes and ways of working despite different planning systems and instances in place across some countries within the region (whilst driving for standardisation in systems).
